text: Ptisana howeana is a rare fern endemic to Lord Howe Island, occasionally found in cultivation. The local names are horse shoe fern or king fern. A large plant, though not particularly tall. The fronds grow to four metres long. The habitat is near streams in dense forest at the southern part of Lord Howe Island, near Mount Lidgbird and Mount Gower. == References == * Category:Marattiidae Category:Flora of Lord Howe Island Category:Ferns of Australia
title: Ptisana howeana
